titleStmt.title: John E. Winn et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5398

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: We the undersigned citizens of Greenupsburg Ky would respectfully represent to his Excellency the Governor of the Commonwealth of Ky. That At the last November Term of the Greenup Circuit Court this the Grand Jury of Greenup County; returned our Indictment Against Geo. E. Roe for suffering Gaming in his office. Roe is our Attorney At Law in Greenupsburg. he is neither a Gambler nor a Black leg. the circumstances are these. on one occasion Some two or three respectable Gentlemen met at Roe's office. & out of mear Sport and past time. they prevailed upon Roe. to permit them to Engage in a little Game of Draw Poker 5 cent Anty. for mear Sport. Roe is a man in humble Circumstances & we are Satisfied. he intended no wrong to the morals of the Community.
We know him & therefore recommend his case as a fit one for Executive clemency. & pray that the fine may be remited.

John E. Winn
John Moran Jailor G C
A. L. Reid S. G. C.
James Morton
W A Womack
Wm Gorum clk
S. Reed D. C.
G W Darlinton
James.H. Morgan
J M Bevins
J B Welsh
R W Robb
Mr Rowe is our atty & knows the violations of law and must abide the consequences
